oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Bobby Goldsboro Parts 1, 2 and 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Bobby Goldsboro (performer) for Nashville's WSM. Tape labeled parts 1, 2 and 3. Recording is from March 25, 1982.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Bobby Goldsboro
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:03) Bobby Goldsboro radio spot for the Ralph Emery Show -- (00:14) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Emery and Goldsboro introduction voiceover] -- (00:30) Emery and Goldsboro discuss how Goldsboro had written "Wings of an Eagle" -- (02:19) Emery introduces a new sponsor, and Emery inquires about the inspiration behind Goldsboro's "Spirit of the West" -- (04:31) Goldsboro discusses his schedule, including his visit to Atlantic City -- (06:34) Goldsboro addresses his time in 1963 where he was touring with Roy Orbison -- (08:14) Emery invites Goldsboro to discuss his time with the Beatles, but promptly stops Goldsboro -- (09:03) Emery invites Goldsboro to joke about the Mac Davis song he recorded "Watching Scotty Grow" and "The Man with the Golden Thumb" -- (12:14) Emery readdresses Goldsboro's time with the Beatles -- (14:29) Emery and Goldsboro reflect on the inability to do normal activities when famous -- (16:35) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Emery and Goldsboro goodbye voiceover] -- (17:50) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Emery and Goldsboro introduction voiceover] -- (18:20) Emery invites Goldsboro to discuss Alabama -- (19:06) Emery inquires about the story of "See the Funny Little Cloud" -- (20:34) Emery and Goldsboro discuss how Goldsboro does his frog impersonation -- (23:06) Emery invites Goldsboro to reflect on his time with Barbara Mandrell -- (23:57) Goldsboro reflects on image people associate with him -- (26:07) Emery inquires about how Goldsboro's work with Del Reeves could be considered his entry into country music -- (28:11) Emery inquires about Goldsboro's family lineage and Goldsboro reveals he was related to a duke -- (31:03) Goldsboro describes the western club that inspired "Round-Up Saloon" -- (32:26) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Emery and Goldsboro goodbye voiceover] -- (33:43) Wings of an Eagle [excerpt] (Bobby Goldsboro) [Featuring Emery and Goldsboro introduction voiceover] -- (34:27) Goldsboro describes the international success of "Honey" in England and his international experiences -- (37:57) Goldsboro and Emery reflect on how "Honey" shaped Goldsboro's image -- (40:14) Emery and Goldsboro reminisce on "Little Things" and the resurgence it had on RCA -- (41:58) Emery and Goldsboro joke about "Wings of an Eagle"
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Goldsboro, Bobby;
